security: The list of names and associated data, such as birthdates and social security numbers, of individuals with security clearances who are members of the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence Activities (pages 7-13) could be exploited for nefarious purposes such as identity theft or blackmail. Also, information regarding COINTELPRO (page 1) could potentially expose sensitive or controversial FBI operations to the public.
summary: This collection of documents primarily relates to the FBI's responses to requests from Congressional committees, particularly the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence Activities (SSC), and includes information on security clearances, COINTELPRO, and other administrative matters.
summary_one_paragraph: This file consists of memoranda, airtels, teletypes, and letters from May and June 1975. It details FBI responses to congressional committee requests, including those from the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence Activities (SSC) regarding intelligence activities and allegations related to COINTELPRO. The documents also cover security clearances for SSC staff, a situation involving an FBI informant in a legal service agency, and a damage assessment related to potential disclosures to the Committee, and oral information provided to the SSC on Martin Luther King, Jr. and Stanley David Levison.
tags: Senate Select Committee on Intelligence Activities
title: Responses to Congressional Committee Requests and Related Matters
recipient: Director, FBI; Honorable Charles E. Wiggins
sender: Legal Counsel; SAC, Atlanta; FROM NEWARK; The Director of Central Intelligence
